intro: Oxydectes heptalon, commonly known as the seven-lobed oxalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Oxalidaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves with three heart-shaped leaflets and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, bead-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is native to regions of South America and thrives in moist, shady environments. Oxydectes heptalon is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
